title: Good oral health improves self-esteem – Doctor
text:
Home » News » Good oral health improves self-esteem – Doctor Good oral health improves self-esteem – Doctor On 5:39 pm In News by Urowayino Warami Comments 
A resident doctor, Dr Segun Fadare, says people need to take charge of their oral health for better quality of life. 
Fadare, of Babcock University Teaching Hospital Annex, Ibadan, said this on Monday in Ibadan against the backdrop of the 2017 World Oral Health Day celebrated annually on March 20. 
The resident doctor said that oral health was essential to the overall health and well-being of people. 
According to him, good oral health also improves self-esteem and enhances social interaction, while poor oral hygiene can lead to serious health conditions. 
“There is a saying that the mouth is the window to the rest of the body; your mouth health has an impact on your overall health. 
“Poor oral health can cause gum diseases that have been linked to diseases like diabetes, cardiovascular problems, stroke, osteoporosis and premature birth. 
“Infections of the mouth pose serious risks to other major organs of the body,” he said. 
Fadare said that adopting good oral health practices early in life could help people to maintain it in old age and ensure the overall health. 
“A good oral hygiene is everything you do to keep your mouth, teeth and especially your gums healthy. 
“It involves brushing your teeth at least twice a day with a fluoride toothpaste, flossing, dental checks every six months and eating healthy foods. 
“You can also maintain good oral health by moderating alcohol intake and avoiding sugary foods and tobacco,” he said.
